identificationModule.officialTitle: AntiCoagulation Tracking InterVention and Evaluation: Using a Customized Panel Management Platform to Improve Outcomes for Patients on Anticoagulation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Anticoagulants are a leading cause of acute injury from adverse drug events, leading to \~20,000 serious injuries reported to the Food and Drug Administration per year and more than 220,000 emergency department visits annually. Therefore, we propose to implement a health information technology (HIT) population management tool at two distinct anticoagulation clinics that will allow the care team to assign and track tasks essential for timely patient monitoring. We will examine its effect on anticoagulation management outcomes through a randomized trial, hypothesizing that such interventions can be effective as well as cost-effective strategies to improve patient safety in the context of anticoagulation management services.

armGroups.label: Intervention Arm
armGroups.description: This cohort of patients will receive panel management through a customize software that integrates with the electronic health record
interventionNames: Other: Panel Management for Anticoagulation Therapy

armGroups.label: Control Arm
armGroups.description: This cohort of patients will receive usual care

interventions.name: Panel Management for Anticoagulation Therapy
interventions.description: Patients in the intervention arm will receive notifications reminding them of upcoming labs and appointments. We hypothesize this will improve adherence and therapeutic control and reduce risk for bleeds and/or strokes

interventions.name: Usual Care
interventions.description: Patients will receive standard, protocolized care in their respective anticoagulation clinics

primaryOutcomes.description: Using the Rosendaal method, we will assess the proportion of the treatment duration that the patient's International Normalized Ratio is within the goal therapeutic range.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Simple ratio of proportion of time patient's International Normalized Ratio is in goal range.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time from initiation to therapeutic INR (TWTR)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to achieve first therapeutic international normalized ratio
Incidence of bleeds, deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, and stroke)

otherOutcomes.measure: Time from out-of-range to patient contact (T2C)
otherOutcomes.description: Time it takes clinicians to respond to abnormal test results
Proportion of patients who receive follow-up in a timely manner as defined by treatment guidelines
Timeliness of treatment duration assessed as percentage of time on therapy in excess of what was prescribed
